required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Diaphragm-releasing Techniques on the Lumbar Spine and Diaphragmatic Function in Healthy Women
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Diaphragm-releasing Techniques on the Lumbar Spine and Diaphragmatic Function in Healthy Women: a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the immediate effects of diaphragmatic release techniques on posterior chain flexibility and lumbar spine amplitude. Respiratory muscle strength and chest cavity mobility in healthy women.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of this study was to evaluate the immediate effects of diaphragmatic release techniques on posterior chain flexibility and lumbar spine amplitude; Respiratory muscle strength and chest cavity mobility in healthy women. This is an intervention study with a randomized controlled trial design. The randomized study in two groups, the Intervention Group in which two diaphragmatic release techniques were performed and the Control Group where two placebo techniques were applied in 75 participants between 18 and 35 years of age. For intragroup analysis the paired Student t test was used, comparing the outcomes before and after the intervention and for intergroup analysis the independent Student t test.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The sample was randomly divided by electronic draw in two groups, the intervention group (GI), where two techniques were performed, one for diaphragmatic release and another for relaxation of the diaphragm pillars. In the control group (CG) the same techniques were applied, but in a placebo form.

primary_outcome.description: Thoracic mobility was measued with a tape as an evaluation tool.

other_outcome.measure: Amplitude of Motion of the Lumbar Spine
other_outcome.description: Tape measure was used as an evaluation tool.
Tape measure was used as an evaluation tool.
manovacuometer was used as an evaluation tool.

arm_group.description: The stretching of the peripheral fibers of the diaphragm
In both placebo techniques, only the light touching of the contacts of the volunteers' skin

intervention.description: The purpose is to generate the stretch of the peripheral fibers of the diaphragm, being performed with the patient in the supine position and the physiotherapist standing on the patient's head and Pulling the Your costal arch In the cephalic direction, for one minute, twice

Second technique aims to promote the rhythmic stretching of the double psoas diaphragm pillars, being performed with The patient in the ventral position and the therapist standing at his side placing the ulnar border of his cephalic hand on the last ribs and his caudal hand flattened in front of the popliteal fossa of the popliteal fossa, stretching was done for one minute

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- sedentary female participants
- aged between 18 and 35 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- those with cardiovascular, respiratory obstructive or restrictive disease
- smokers and ex-smokers
- who were or were submitted to speech therapy less than a year ago
- those with postural deviation type scoliosis

responsible_party.investigator_title: University professor of physiotherapy course Federal University of Ceará

group.title: Diaphragmatic Release
group.description: The stretching of the peripheral fibers of the diaphragm Diaphragm lift: The purpose is to generate the stretch of the peripheral fibers of the diaphragm, being performed with the patient in the supine position and the physiotherapist standing on the patient's head and Pulling the Your costal arch In the cephalic direction, for one minute, twice Relaxation of the diaphragm pillars: Second technique aims to promote the rhythmic stretching of the double psoas diaphragm pillars, being performed with The patient in the ventral position and the therapist standing at his side placing the ulnar border of his cephalic hand on the last ribs and his caudal hand flattened in front of the popliteal fossa of the popliteal fossa, stretching was done for one minute

measure.title: Thoracic Mobility
measure.description: Thoracic mobility was measued with a tape as an evaluation tool.

analysis.groups_desc: A paired t-test was used for intragroup analysis, and an independent Student’s t-test was used for intergroup analysis. Data are represented in mean between-group difference with a 95% CI, and analysis was by intention to treat.

outcome.title: Amplitude of Motion of the Lumbar Spine
outcome.description: Tape measure was used as an evaluation tool.

outcome.title: Posterior Chain Flexibility
outcome.description: Tape measure was used as an evaluation tool.

outcome.title: Maximum Respiratory Pressure
outcome.description: manovacuometer was used as an evaluation tool.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
